abstract: A computer security specialist said the flaw could be exploited by an attacker who might trick a G1 user into visiting a booby-trapped Web site.
snippet: A computer security specialist said the flaw could be exploited by an attacker who might trick a G1 user into visiting a booby-trapped Web site.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Just days after the T-Mobile G1 smartphone went on the market, a group of security researchers have found what they call a serious flaw in the Android software from Google that runs it.

headline.main: Security Flaw Is Revealed in T-Mobile’s Google Phone
headline.print_headline: Security Flaw Is Revealed In T-Mobile’s Google Phone
